detailsOfAchievement: Nodal NGO for Santhal pargana by CAPART Lead NGO of Jahrkhand Anti Trafficking Program Established partnership with Tribal Welfare Commissioner, JSTCDC, JSACS, NABARD, District Administration (SGSY), CAPART, & Various donor agencies to implement development programs for the disadvantaged/ tribal/ differently abled/ women/ youth/ minorities/ children/ youth for their sustainable development & empowerment. Since inception more than 10000 families have been covered directly & indirectly for their sustenance. Different grass root developmental agencies have been capacitated to provide services to the needy communities. Advocated with different Networks on different issues focussing entitlement realization, benefit to differently abled, child rights, youth policy framing, etc. Research / Study/ Documentation support to national & international agencies are being provided on regular assignment basis with its experts. RIGHT BASED Actions are being advocated for the communities in need. Vision: to promote egalitarian, empowered and self-reliant society through tangible efforts of the voluntary organizations Mission: To build the capacity of the community in general and the grass root organizations in particular to take up the responsibility to further enhancing the capacities of the most marginalized and vulnerable section for its empowerment. Goal: Establishment of an empowered, gender sensitive and just society

detailsOfAchievement: To provide academic and technical resource support to literacy programmes through organising training programmes, material development and production, publication, extension activities, innovative projects, research studies and evaluations. Besides that, monitoring and supervision of on-going literacy programme by State Resource Centre (SRC) is a continuous process. Achievements so far, Training: Altogether 379 training programmes were organized for 10138 persons of various categories. Material Development: Total 182 books including CE Books, training manuals, e-Primers, vocational training manuals and promotional materials etc. have been developed for the basic literacy, computer literacy and equivalency programme. Development of district specific Post Literacy Primer for Pakur, Koderma, Latehar, Garhwa, Giridih and Lohardaga districts during 2007 â€“ 2009. Innovative: Orientation of 1350 PRI Functionaries of four districts on Saakshar Bharat under BP GP Presidents Campaign. Production and broadcasting of Radio programme: 10 episodes of Radio Drama, 30 minutes each, titled Kahani Gunja Ki along with Jingles and Spots were broadcasted during March â€“ May, 2006. 12 episode of Radio drama on literacy was broadcasted in 2009. Computer Based Functional Literacy Programme: Successfully organised 19 camp based Computer Based Functional Litearcy Programme in eight districts of Jharkhand. Above 850 females were enrolled under this programme The enrolled females were imparted skill development training also such as cutting and tailoring, mehandi designing and beautician course. Model Adult Education Centres (AECs): Established and running 20 model AECs in rural areas of Jharkhand with financial support from RECL under CSR initiatives. Saansad Aadarsh Gram (SAGY): Altogether 19 GPs have been adopted under SAGY by Hon MPs in Jharkhand,12 are under jurisdiction of SRC, Ranchi. Right from environment building to training teaching learning and monitoring of SAakshar Bharat Programme is being carried out by SRC. Besides that Awareness Camps on issues like Financial Literacy, Legal Literacy etc. are also being organized under inter personal media campaign. So far, 11334 learners have been enrolled under basic literacy and more than 10000 have been declared literate through an assessment test conducted by NIOS and NLMA. Environmental Literacy Programme: Environment building activities is being carried out by SRC in the identified villages of 5 GPs near the bank of river Ganga in Sahibganj districts. Interpersonal Media Campaign: Awareness programme on Electoral, Legal and Financial literacy have been organized as a part of environment building for Saakshar Bharat. Launched in 2014, more than 200 awareness camps were organized so far.

detailsOfAchievement: Promoted 98578 SHGs with 1182936 women and linked them with Banks for credit to start smaller bussiness - Received best award from NABARD for outstanding performance in SHG. Digitization of SHG programme helps SHGs to get financial benefits from banks and other govt. departments. this programme fulfils the mission of digital India. supported by through NABARD for Ramgarh Dist. Successfully Implementing Mahila Kisan Sashakti Karan Pariyojna for empowering 3300 women farmers who are actively engaged in Agriculture, operating own or family land or labouring for wages. SUPPORT is implementing five CFTs in five Block of Jharkhand. SUPPORT has developed innovative Successful livelihood models such as Annpurna model, 36x36 model, DSR, SRI, creeper with machan, Nadep Compost, Wormy Compost, Chilli value chain and VOs, federation of SHGs. Worked for Drinking water and sanitation as Block Resource Centre through SWSM, Jharkhand Govt. Promoted vaccinators for Backyard poultry in 1 Block of Ramgarh District and 5 blocks of Hazaribag District. In livestock promotion it has promoted pig rearing, goat rearing, duck rearing. in horticulture it has successfully implemented NHM programme in which 200 ha of Mango plantation was done in hazaribag district with Holy Cross SSC- promoting Diversion based irrigation with APFRO- promoting biodiversity with SPWD, RANCHI. In 500 acres of land mix horticulture was done in which Mango and Guava was planted through TDF WADI NABARD. Implementing Prototype Phase I water Harvesting , irrigation and land development- Successfully implemented six micro watershed under DPAP with DRDA, Hazaribag and Ramgarh - Livelihood programme in 10 tribal village where food security achived from seven months to ten months with collaboration with Sir Ratan Trust and CInI- Successfully implemented 35 water harvesting structure through MGNREGA in churchu block. 8 water harvesting structure and 7 wells through through TDF WADI NABARD project. 20 low lying wells through TATA trust. with colaboration with NABARD 12 farmers club have been formed. T&D variety of piglets were provided and adopted one village for holistic development.

sourceOfFunds.departmentName: Women Child Development and Social Welfare Department Govt of Jharkhand Ranchi
sourceOfFunds.purpose: Under Jivan Kaushal, Sakhi Saheli, Kishori Diwas, Vocational Training and Nutritive health and Social Services programmes conducted in Ratu, Bundu, Nagri (Ranchi) Birni, Dhanwar, Deori and Gawan blocks (Giridih) trainings to kishoris of ages 11 to 14 and 14 to 18 were given.Kishoris of ages 11 to 14 were made aware about their mental growth and development, about the beginning of menstrual cycle,personal hygiene, good health,life skills. Kishoris of ages 14 to 18 were taught about life skills.

In this financial year 2018-19, no monetary support was given from the other concerned sources but the organization took the initiative and itself conducted awareness campaigns, trainings for peoples welfare in the fields of education, womens empowerment, general awareness, personal hygiene and sanitation and trainings to unemployed youths for entrepreneurship. Adolescent girls were made aware about life skills , abouth the personal cleanliness and sanitation to be maintanined in daily life.

title: Yuva Rangmanch
detailsOfAchievement: With Some young artistes trained in NSD workshop held in Ranchi in 1981 along with some unemployed youths, hailing from tribal and backward areas and some engineers, journalists, teachers and industrial workers, Ajai Malkani along with Mr. Avinash Singh, Bipin Kumar etc. formed Yuva Rangmanch, with an aim to motivate common people through theatre and other cultural activities, ascertaining their active participation to bring about a change for the betterment of the society. The group has organized 40 Theatre workshops in the tribal region and has trained about 450 budding talents and has successfully given a scientific direction to the theatre movement in Jharkhand. The group has staged 350 shows of almost 40 plays inspiring both rural and urban youth. The group has staged two plays namely â€“ ULGULAN KA ANT NAHI (Based on Indiaâ€™s Freedom struggle by Tribals against British Rule) and Kya Choot Raha hai (A Social and Philosophical manifestations) in Bharat Rang Mahotsav in the year 2001 and 2002 organized by national school of Drama (NSD) New Delhi. Besides founder director Ajai Malkani the group consists of Theatre professionals from NSD, BNA Lucknow and Department of Indian Theatre, Punjab University Yuva Rangmanch , besides being actively engaged in experimental innovation in modern Indian theatre, research and training , is also conducting experimentation and presentation of fine arts classical Kathak and folk dances in association with Haren Thakur , Subir Das ,Beena Tripathy ,Ankita Chakraborty, Gargi Malkani.and Malobika Mukherjee. Recently our Classical Kathak and Folk Dances have performed in 34th National Games organized at Khel Goan, Ranchi in the month of Feb 2011.
